if TextDecoder isn’t supported, it makes an iframe, sets its encoding to JIS, writes the bytes to it, and has it send decoded text back
I built a little thing which pulls the title out of PS2 save icon.sys files & decodes the ShiftJIS …creatively 🤔 https://t.co/o3uiv2PCZi
@rhysforyou yepppp, and given HDD-installed games use their save icon by default, I wanna make nice ones for those!
I think maybe what I’ll do is implement these libraries *correctly* and also in Rust maybe(?)

@pupperfly I carve out the title (which is encoded in JIS), send it to an iframe (JIS), JS in iframe sends the title back (UTF-8 ✨)
@pupperfly they’re a 964-byte binary blob with a known magic header and known offsets
